definition[0]: to cause serious arguments in a group of people
example[0]: Scandal is tearing the government apart.
example[1]: a row that tore the family apart
definition[1]: to separate people who are in a close relationship with each other
definition[2]: to make someone feel extremely unhappy or upset
example[3]: Seeing her so upset really tore him apart.
definition[3]: to break something violently into a lot of small pieces
example[4]: Her body had been torn apart by wolves.
